nodes.bodyText: Sure, but I'm going to add more content than just this article. In my mind, I think we should put the section first that people are more likely to read first. So, are they more likely to read introductory articles first or JLBPs first, assuming they land at the front page? (I wouldn't count people who land directly on a JLBP for this question, because they went there for a reason, probably following a search result or external link)

nodes.bodyText:
I know we created the site for the JLBPs, but I think it is myopic to strictly limit the site to JLBPs. The content I would like to add helps people to understand the motivation for the JLBPs better and I believe it will drive more traffic to the site in a synergistic way. The site will be "heavier" and be more interlinked, meaning people will stay longer and search engines will rank it as more important.
For the time being, I'm fine with putting the links to introductory content below the JLBPs in order to move forward. I don't want to isolate it into its own landing page yet.
